description: Extension to an existing vehicle crossover and hardstanding along frontage of 590 Upper Brentwood Road
decision_conditions: The proposed extension to the existing vehicular crossover and driveway to the front of units 1 and 2 would by reason of its layout would result in unsatisfactory parking arrangement for the future occupiers of the site and by reason of its proximity close to the nearby junction, would likely to result in road safety hazards and the free flow of the traffic detrimental to the safety of pedestrians and other road users, contrary to London Plan Policies T4 and T6, the Havering Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD and Domestic Vehicle Dropped Kerb Policy April 2023.

The proposal to alter the approved forecourt of the semi-detached property on site would adversely impact on the appearance, character and nature of site and surrounding area, and would further impact on the amenity of occupiers at unit 1 of the approved scheme, contrary to the aims and objectives of Policies 7, 26 and 27 of the Local Plan 2021.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, it was necessary to issue a decision as close to the statutory timeframe as possible as opposed to seeking amendments which would have significantly delayed the application.
